alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued March 31 at 4:11PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR FINE PARTICULATES FROM 400 PM FRIDAY UNTIL 900 AM SATURDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Fine Particulates. WHERE...Jefferson County. Locations include, but are not limited to Golden. WHEN...400 PM Friday March 31 to 900 AM Saturday April 01 IMPACTS...Air Quality Health Advisory for Wildfire Smoke Issued for Jefferson County Issued at 4:00 PM MDT, Friday, March 31, 2023 Issued by the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment Affected Area: central Jefferson County, including, but not limited to, Morrison, Golden, Lakewood and surrounding areas. Advisory in Effect: 3:30 PM MDT, Friday, March 31, 2023 to 9:00 AM MDT, Saturday, April 1, 2023. Public Health Recommendations: If smoke is thick or becomes thick in your neighborhood you may want to remain indoors. This is especially true for those with heart disease, respiratory illnesses, the very young, and the elderly. Consider limiting outdoor activity when moderate to heavy smoke is present. Consider relocating temporarily if smoke is present indoors and is making you ill. If visibility is less than 5 miles in smoke in your neighborhood, smoke has reached levels that are unhealthy. Outlook: A fire burning in the foothills of Jefferson County ignited on Friday afternoon. Smoke is likely in close proximity to this fire. Strong, gusty winds are expected to continue until this evening, and smoke from this fire could impact locations downwind of the fire as well. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: If smoke is thick or becomes thick in your neighborhood you may want to remain indoors. This is especially true for those with heart disease, respiratory illnesses, the very young, and the elderly. Consider limiting outdoor activity when moderate to heavy smoke is present. Consider relocating temporarily if smoke is present indoors and is making you ill. If visibility is less than 5 miles in smoke in your neighborhood, smoke has reached levels that are unhealthy.
